# A Prime Example
- Cryptography
- Hard
- 400 Points

## Description

`Ha! You dumb humans are so bad at cryptography that I decided to give you a head start, not that it will make a
difference. I encrypted my messages using RSA but not only will I give you the product of both of the primes, I
will give you the sum as well.`

## Hints
- Try combining the equations given to you and note what is a constant (even if its big)
- Decode the final result to a string from hexadecimal 

## Solution

You are given 3 things,

x, where x = p + q
n, where n = p * q
c, where c = the ciphertext

Note here are the two primes, p and q.

x = p + q
p = x - q
n = (x - q) * q
n = -q^2 + xq
0 = -q^2 + xq - n

Now we can solve this equation using the quadratic equation. After using the
equation to solve the equation you can reverse engineer the RSA algorithm to decode
the cipher text

E = 5

p = 

q = 

n = 

p + q = 

ciphertext =
